ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Given that this is a two week intensive seminar I feel that some of the concepts were hard to grasp in the limited time to reflect upon them. the teaching team perfomed a fantastic work to go over the very extensive material available.
Any one irrespective of legal background will benefit from this course immensely

This class is very interesting and important to understand how different legal systems work around the world. It is also very helpful to have general knowledge on how to approach initiatives dealing with countries that might have different legal systems and what are the advantages and disadvantages of having multilateral agreements, conventions, and general natural resource mangagement.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Discussions
The expertise of the professors and their personal examples for every different legal tradition in the world, enriched my learning experience.
This course is very informative and inspiring. The course covers a wide range of topics - from different legal systems to specific cases.
The seminar format and the ability to have a dialogue.
Different kinds of environmental laws and comparing among the countries the students are interested in
The background readings.
The lectures were generally excellent. Prof. Robinson seems to know a little about everything. Having two professors brought different perspectives to the class.
The lectures, the readings, and the professors.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I know my suggestion could be logistically difficult, but given the amount of content in the course, I would expand the duration of the seminar. Maybe having one week with Prof. Lye and then several weeks with Prof. Robinson, combining schedules for when he teaches in Yale College. It is just frustrating to have such a huge ammount of reading and not enough time to read it, or digest the readings even.I would have discussion sections with the TA all along the semester to have an higher engagement in the readings.
One of the instructors (Robinson) seems significantly more Knowledgeable than the other (Lye). Important to include instructors directly familiar with civil law or from a civil law country.
Some readings need to be sorted out and be placed under the correct heading. Quite confusing.
I wish the course could be extended for a longer period of time, with the readings spread out between more classes.

I felt like some ideas we covered needed to be covered more in-depth and have more time for questions from students. However, it was difficult to fully engage because the class goes by so quickly (two-week intensive instead of full semester).
It would be ideal to have the class distributed in more than 2 weeks, through conference calls in order to grasp more information.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: It was terrific!
Yes. It's very effective.
Discussions esp with Prof. Robinson were all very educative and useful.
Yes, very effective.
discussion wasn't separate. If we had questions during the lecture, we asked them at that time.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Interest in environmental law

Given my concentration in environmental policy with an international focus, this class is essential to understand many aspects of international negotiations. I believe that knowing how the different legal traditions may respond to a specific case, it's beneficial to have this knowledge in ongoing climate change negotiations or other environmental conventions.

I opened the door of environmental law for me. The topics covered in this course help me understand better how the discourse on critical environmental issues, at international, national, and local levels work.
It's important for an understanding of international environmental policy.

Since i have a legal background, this course kind of complemented my broad knowledge of the environmental law. From cultural aspect, Environmental Impact Assessment, public participation to role of judiciary,are all dealt under this course.
My curriculum is focused on public policy and social sciences. I wanted to take a law class to round out my program and this was relevant.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Interest in EL
I was very interested in the topic of international environmental law.
I was attracted by the name, I thought it was interesting and informative, and it really is.
Both for the content and the professor.
I took this course in order to learn more than environmental impact assessment laws and processes in other country.
I wanted to understand the legal frameworks in two different jurisdictions for my research.
Because I'm interested on how biodiversity is conserved within different regimes and how protection varies from one legal system to the other.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: YES!
It's very soon to determine the application but really great expectations into the application of the knowledge acquired in the class.
Definitely!
Yes, the course did meet my expectations. Working with Prof. Robinson on the Comparative EIA law was very useful and an enriching learning process.
Yes!
I thought the class lectures were interesting. This was a crash course in the different legal traditions of the world. I think this knowledge will stay with me and help me with future analysis.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Since the group work in this course is more of plenary, some people took advantage and talked non-stop. However, it was a good forum for sharing different national laws and ideas.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: ENJOY!!!
Do not be intimidated by the ammount of readings and hours, this course is worth the effort.
Do readings selectively and come to the classroom with some questions.

I would encourage everyone to take this course. And from beginning of the course, take advantage of Prof. Robinson and Lye. Having your own topic and constant discussions with them on it can give you better idea of your paper as well as learn so much which you may not be aware of.
The intensive structure can be trying. I got the most out of the lectures though, so try to attend every day.
Do the readings and work on several drafts of your paper so professors can check it and you can have an excellent job done.
